choices.text: Peristalsis due to flow of urine
Relation to renal vein and artery

questions.text: Ureters are identified during surgery by: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is the answer as intraoperatively peristaltic movement of the ureter help to identify the ureter. There is a high chance that it will get confused with other structures so peristaltic movement is used to make sure that structure is ureter. In pelvic surgeries like APR and LAR we sometimes subject the patient to pre-operative DJ stenting before the operative procedure. We can not trace the ureter based on the rich arterial plexus, relation of renal vein and renal artery or relation of lumbar plexus.

questions.text: Ureteric constriction is seen at all the following positions, except (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) there is no constriction of the ureter at the level of the ischial spine . There are 5 recognised narrowings in the ureter which may present obstacles to a stone’s passage through to the bladder and these are the PUJ, the point at which the ureter crosses the bifurcation of the common iliac artery and three areas in the distal ureter out of which ureterovesical junction is the narrowest part. Following figure shows the normal constrictions present in the ureter.

choices.text: Gonadal vessels lie anterior to it
It lies in front of great vessels

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Answer A is right as gonadal vessels are one of the many structures which pass anterior to the ureter Option B is wrong as ureters don’t lie anterior to great vessels they lie lateral to the great vessels Option C is wrong as the length of the ureter is 26 cm and not 50 cm Option D is false as ureters are innervated by segment T11-L2 of the spinal cord segment and not segment T8-T10

questions.text: Ectopic ureter opening is not located in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Whenever there is duplication of ureter in kidney it follows Weigert Mayer’s Law which states that if there is a complete duplication of ureter then the ureter draining the lower pole opens at a normal location but the ureter draining the upper pole drain distally and at an ectopic location. Most common site of ectopic ureteric orifice in males is prostatic urethra. In males the ectopic ureteric opening is never present distal to the external urethral sphincter so it will not open in bulbar urethra. Ectopic ureter can open into seminal vesicle, bladder neck or a prostatic urethra with prostatic urethra being the most common site.

questions.text: A 9 years old boy presented with abdominal pain and recurrent UTI, IVP reveals duplication of left ureter. The most likely site of ectopic opening would be: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common site of ectopic ureter in males is prostatic urethra, so they present with UTI as the most common symptom . Males do not have incontinence as the opening lies proximal to external urethral sphincter. On the other hand the most common site of opening of ectopic ureter in females is distal 2/3rd of ureter so females present with typical history of incontinence along with passage of normal urine. In cases of a complete duplication, ureter draining the upper pole can open into ejaculatory duct, seminal vesicle and vas deferens but that is not the most common site. Whenever there is duplication of ureter in kidney , it follows Weigert Meyer's Law which states that if there is a complete duplication of ureter ,than the ureter draining the lower pole opens at a normal location but the ureter draining the upper pole drain distally and at an ectopic location.

Correct Answer (D) Weigert-Meyers rule is associated with complete ureteric duplication. It basically states that in complete ureteric duplication the ureter which drain the lower pole opens at the normal position while the ureter which drains the upper pole opens more distally and at an ectopic location. In this ectopic ureter is associated with ureterocele in most of the cases.

questions.text: In the male, the most common site of termination of the ectopic ureter is the: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common site of ectopic ureter in males is prostatic urethra, so they present with UTI as the most common symptom . Males do not have incontinence as the opening lies proximal to external urethral sphincter. On the other hand the most common site of opening of ectopic ureter in females is distal 2/3rd of ureter so females present with typical history of incontinence along with passage of normal urine. In case of a duplication of ureter the ureter draining the upper pole never opens distal to the external urethral sphincter in males so it never opens in anterior urethra. In cases of a complete duplication, ureter draining the upper pole can open into seminal vesicle and vas deferens but that is not the most common site.

choices.text: Ureteral incontinence with otherwise normal voiding

questions.text: Classic symptom of ectopic ureter in females: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Most common site of ectopic ureter in males is prostatic urethra, so they present with UTI as the most common symptom . Males do not have incontinence as the opening lies proximal to external urethral sphincter. On the other hand the most common site of opening of ectopic ureter in females is distal 2/3rd of ureter so females present with typical history of incontinence along with passage of normal urine. Painful defecation and labial swelling are not the presentations of ectopic ureter. Urinary frequency is another presentation of ectopic ureter but not the most common presentation.

questions.text: MC presentation of ectopic ureter in males: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common site of ectopic ureter in males is prostatic urethra, so they present with UTI as the most common symptom . Males do not have incontinence as the opening lies proximal to external urethral sphincter. On the other hand the most common site of opening of ectopic ureter in females is distal 2/3rd of ureter so females present with typical history of incontinence along with passage of normal urine. Epididymitis, Pelvic pain and seminal vesicle infection are other presentations of ectopic ureter but the most common is recurrent UTI.

questions.text: Cobra head appearance on excretory urography is suggestive (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Cobra head appearance on excretory urography is suggestive of ureterocele. It is also referred to as adder head appearance. Horseshoe kidney has joined lower poles and they can show shake hand appearance on IVP, the bend in the ureter in case of horse shoe kidney appears as a flower vase sign on IVP. Duplication of ureter is another finding which can be picked up on IVP Simple cysts may show up on IVP and can be diagnosed.

choices.text: Stretching of renal capsule due to back pressure
Increased peristalsis of ureter to overcome the obstruction

questions.text: Ureteric colic due to stone is caused by: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ureter undergoes increased peristalsis in order to overcome the obstruction,therefore it leads to a colicky pain.

questions.text: A 50 years old female is admitted with abdominal pain and anuria. Radiological studies revealed: bilateral impacted ureteric stones with hydronephrosis. Urine analysis showed RBCs with pus cells in urine. Serum creatinine level was 16 mg/dl and urea level was 200 mmol. Which of the following should be the immediate treatment? (AIIMS May 2014)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This scenario shows a case of neglected ureteric calculi which has led to hydronephrosis and urinary tract infection and patient also has developed signs of renal failure as creatinine has risen above the normal limit. It is very important in this case to relieve the obstruction in the renal system and give the kidney to regain its function and hopefully reduction in the creatinine values. For this best method is Double J stenting of the ureter which reduces the pressure in the pelvicalyceal system . If DJ stenting fails we have to subject the patient to percutaneous nephrostomy to relive the pressure in the pelvicalyceal system. If the patient has acute rentention with UTI we do not go for immediate ureteroscopic retrival of stone, it is done once the kidney regains its functions and patient shows signs of improvement and reduction in creatinine value. Hemodialysis is reserved if the kidney does not show any signs of improvement and patient has persistent rise in creatinine values. Lithotripsy is not done in an acute scenario

questions.text: What complication should one expect when PCNL is done through 11th intercostals space? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) PCNL stands for percutaneous nephrolithotomy and it is a procedure done for the treatment of renal stones which are more than 2 cm in size. In this what we do is we create a track from skin to the calyces of the kidney, introduce a nephroscope in the calyces of kidney, then we try to break the stones into small pieces and then we remove the fragments, some of the fragments are washed away in the urine. As we have to make a track from skin to the kidney most common complication of PCNL is hematoma formation. As this a blind procedure done under C-Arm there is a high chance of injury to the structures. We can end up injuring Pleura, colon and spleen. Pleura is most commonly injured and patients develop pneumothorax. Coming back to this question as the question says we approached through 11th intercostal space there is a high chance of injuring the underlying pleura and leading to Pneumothorax. Hematuria can commonly occur with this procedure too but in this question there is higher chance of pleural injury.

questions.text: A 10 mm calculus in the right lower ureter associated with proximal hydroureteronephrosis is best treated with:
Treatment used for lower ureteric stone is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A that is endoscopic retrival of stone is used for lower ureteric stones because ESWL and PCNL cannot be used for lower ureteric stones. Diuretics can be used for small stones which are less than the size of 5 mm as they get flushed out by the diuretic. Option C that is drug dissolution is not a good treatment option for renal or ureteric stone. Lasers are not safe for the treatment of ureteric stones, we use holmium YAG laser for the treatment of bladder stones.

questions.text: LASER used in treatment of ureteric calculi: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Laser treatment is an upcoming modality for the treatment of renal stones. We use Holmium Yag laser for the treatment of renal stones. One important point to remember is that when Holmium YAG laser is used for the treatment of uric acid stone there is production of cyanide but the good part is this is not absorbed systemically and so it does not lead to cyanide toxicity. Holmium YAG laser is also used for the treatment of BPH. We do not use Nd-Yag, Argon and CO2 lasers for the treatment of urological diseases.

Correct Answer (C) When TB passes from kidney to urinary bladder ureters can get affected and develop fibrosis, stricture and shortening over a period of time. Due to shortening of ureters it appears that the ureteric orifice has been pulled up and when this ureteric orifice is visualized under cystoscopy it appears like a golf hole ureteric orifice.
